description: Returns the list of access grants in your S3 Access Grants instance. You must have the s3:ListAccessGrants permission to use this operation.

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the S3 Access Grants instance.

parameters.name: GranteeType
parameters.description: The type of the grantee to which access has been granted. It can be one of the following values: IAM - An IAM user or role. DIRECTORY_USER - Your corporate directory user. You can use this option if you have added your corporate identity directory to IAM Identity Center and associated the IAM Identity Center instance with your S3 Access Grants instance. DIRECTORY_GROUP - Your corporate directory group. You can use this option if you have added your corporate identity directory to IAM Identity Center and associated the IAM Identity Center instance with your S3 Access Grants instance.

parameters.name: Permission
parameters.description: The type of permission granted to your S3 data, which can be set to one of the following values: READ --- Grant read-only access to the S3 data. WRITE --- Grant write-only access to the S3 data. READWRITE --- Grant both read and write access to the S3 data.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A pagination token to request the next page of results. Pass this value into a subsequent List Access Grants request in order to retrieve the next page of results.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantsList
nested_items.description: A container for a list of grants in an S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when you created the S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantId
nested_items.description: The ID of the access grant. S3 Access Grants auto-generates this ID when you create the access grant.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access grant.

nested_items.name: GranteeType
nested_items.description: The type of the grantee to which access has been granted. It can be one of the following values:
IAM - An IAM user or role.

DIRECTORY_USER - Your corporate directory user. You can use this option if you have added your corporate identity directory to IAM Identity Center and associated the IAM Identity Center instance with your S3 Access Grants instance.

DIRECTORY_GROUP - Your corporate directory group. You can use this option if you have added your corporate identity directory to IAM Identity Center and associated the IAM Identity Center instance with your S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: GranteeIdentifier
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the Grantee. If the grantee type is IAM, the identifier is the IAM Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user or role. If the grantee type is a directory user or group, the identifier is 128-bit universally unique identifier (UUID) in the format a1b2c3d4-5678-90ab-cdef-EXAMPLE11111. You can obtain this UUID from your Amazon Web Services IAM Identity Center instance.

nested_items.name: Permission
nested_items.description: The type of access granted to your S3 data, which can be set to one of the following values:
READ --- Grant read-only access to the S3 data.
WRITE --- Grant write-only access to the S3 data.
READWRITE --- Grant both read and write access to the S3 data.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantsLocationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the registered location to which you are granting access. S3 Access Grants assigns this ID when you register the location. S3 Access Grants assigns the ID default to the default location s3:// and assigns an auto-generated ID to other locations that you register.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantsLocationConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration options of the grant location. The grant location is the S3 path to the data to which you are granting access.

nested_items.name: S3SubPrefix
nested_items.description: The S3SubPrefix is appended to the location scope creating the grant scope. Use this field to narrow the scope of the grant to a subset of the location scope. This field is required if the location scope is the default location s3:// because you cannot create a grant for all of your S3 data in the Region and must narrow the scope. For example, if the location scope is the default location s3://, the S3SubPrefx can be a <bucket-name>/*, so the full grant scope path would be s3://<bucket-name>/*. Or the S3SubPrefx can be <bucket-name>/<prefix-name>*, so the full grant scope path would be or s3://<bucket-name>/<prefix-name>*.

nested_items.name: GrantScope
nested_items.description: The S3 path of the data to which you are granting access. It is the result of appending the Subprefix to the location scope.

nested_items.name: ApplicationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services IAM Identity Center application associated with your Identity Center instance. If the grant includes an application ARN, the grantee can only access the S3 data through this application.
